AdditionalFields.Value: Drug Development,Molecular/Cellular Biology and Genetics,Experimental and Molecular Therapeutics

Description: Effective therapies for solid cancers continue to be elusive, in part due to the presence of recurrent genomic alterations that result in the inactivation of tumor suppressor genes or the oncogenic activation of transcription factors. This session will discuss the therapeutic potential of biological and molecular mechanisms operating in solid cancers driven by genomic alterations notoriously difficult to target such as those involving p53, c-Myc and c-Myb. Topics explored will include ubiquitination-dependent mechanisms of cancer cell plasticity in p53-mutated squamous cell carcinoma, phosphoinositide kinase activities and targeting in p53-deficient breast cancer, and Notch signaling in c-Myb-driven adenoid cystic carcinoma. The speakers will discuss in vivo models generated to assess the biological significance of these processes and to provide support for their potential therapeutic value.
SearchResultBody: SY33. Biological Basis of Novel Targets for Solid Tumors
Title: Biological Basis of Novel Targets for Solid Tumors
